page.name: xaf/dynamic-queries/static
page.summary: Once all the rules (fields, joins, conditions, etc) are defined then SQL statements can be generated and cached at application startup. Instead of creating static SQL statements in code or even the SQL Libraries feature of XAF, programmers can create query definitions (rules) and let the XAF generate the SQL. This allows much better data abstraction because when the database columns, tables, or rules change only the query definition needs to be updated (as opposed to potentially dozens of SQL statements).
